qas.question: Where was the BBC's transmitter located in 1930?
When did the BBC start broadcasting under the name BBC One?
What was the title of the first show seen on the BBC?

answers.text: Opening of the BBC Television Service

qas.question: Which members of British royalty were seen on the BBC in May of 1937?

answers.text: King George VI and Queen Elizabeth

qas.question: When did the BBC cease broadcasts due to World War II?
What year did 30-line television broadcasts by Logie John Baird begin?

plausible_answers.text: coronation of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth

qas.question: What broadcast event took place in September 1939?
What happened to service in May of 1939?

context: Mechanically scanned, 30-line television broadcasts by John Logie Baird began in <b5_0>1929<b5_0/>, using the BBC transmitter in London, and by 1930 a regular schedule of programmes was transmitted from the BBC antenna in <a0_0>Brookmans Park<a0_0/>. Television production was switched from Baird's company to what is now known as BBC One on <a1_0><b6_0>2 August 1932<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and continued until September 1935. <b7_0>Regularly scheduled electronically scanned television<b7_0/> began from Alexandra Palace in London on 2 November 1936, to just a few hundred viewers in the immediate area. The first programme broadcast – and thus the first ever, on a dedicated TV channel – was "<a2_0>Opening of the BBC Television Service<a2_0/>" at 15:00. The first major outside broadcast was the <b8_0>coronation of <a3_0>King George VI and Queen Elizabeth<b8_0/><a3_0/> in May 1937. The service was reaching an estimated 25,000–40,000 homes before the outbreak of World War II which caused the <b9_0>service to be suspended<b9_0/> in <a4_0>September 1939<a4_0/>. The VHF broadcasts would have provided an ideal radio beacon for German bombers homing in on London, and the engineers and technicians of the service would be needed for the war effort, in particular the radar programme.
